organizations.name: Ashwood Foundation
organizations.overview: A militant, anti-supernatural organization dedicated to eradication of all non-human entities. Believes coexistence is impossible and humanity must purge the shadows to survive.
organizations.history: Founded by WWI veterans and prohibition-era lawmen after encountering inexplicable horrors. Grew during WWII as a clandestine monster-hunting force. Rebuilt in 1947 as a nationwide militia for supernatural extermination.
philosophy: Humanity must cleanse the hidden world.
locations: Safehouses in Chicago, Detroit, Denver, Baltimore

notableNPCs.name: Silas Vane
notableNPCs.description: WWII hero with a cold, strategic mind. Believes coexistence is impossible and views all supernatural beings as threats.

notableNPCs.name: Dr. Eleanor Graves
notableNPCs.description: Brilliant occult scholar secretly sympathetic toward benevolent supernatural beings.

notableNPCs.name: Marcus 'Buckshot' Hale
notableNPCs.description: Legendary hunter missing an arm from a werewolf encounter; holds deep hatred for lycanthropes.

secrets: Attempted to weaponize a captured vampire who later escaped.
Possesses classified files on angelic activities during WWII.
A radical faction seeks to exterminate supernatural-friendly humans.

organizations.name: Covenant of St. Michael
organizations.motto: In darkness, truth. In truth, mercy.
organizations.overview: A protective, spiritual order dedicated to balance between humanity and the supernatural. Advocates discernment and mercy, fighting only when necessary.
organizations.history: Descended from European ritual orders. Migrated to America in the 19th century. Expanded globally and now functions as mediators, exorcists, and scholars.
philosophy: Not all supernatural beings are evil.
Justice and truth come before judgment.

structure.The Choir: Mysterious council believed to include angelic influence.

notableNPCs.name: Father Jonah Mercer
notableNPCs.description: Former soldier turned priest, calm and wise. Believes every being deserves a chance at redemption.

notableNPCs.name: Sister Calista Ward
notableNPCs.description: Performs miracles few can explain. Whispers say she may be part angel.

notableNPCs.name: Elias Crowe
notableNPCs.description: Expert negotiator with cryptids and spirits. Deeply distrusts the Black Chamber.

secrets: The Choir may include disguised angels.
Prophecy tied to 'The Midnight Rise' and supernatural bloodlines.
Protects a repentant demon in secret.

organizations.name: The Black Chamber
organizations.motto: Knowledge is power. Power is control.
organizations.overview: A covert U.S. government division that captures, studies, and weaponizes supernatural forces for national security and advantage.
organizations.history: Evolved from Room 108 and the earlier Cipher Bureau. Reborn in WWII to investigate Nazi occult research. Now a Cold War shadow agency exploiting supernatural phenomena.
philosophy: America must win the occult arms race.

structure.Director of Special Phenomena: Overall director of Black Chamber operations.
structure.Project Heads: Lead researchers on specific supernatural programs.
structure.Handlers: Operate trained or bound supernatural assets.

notableNPCs.name: Dr. Miriam Locke
notableNPCs.description: Brilliant and cold. Sees monsters as untapped military assets.

notableNPCs.name: Agent Victor Harlow
notableNPCs.description: Charming and ruthless. Known for capturing live supernatural beings more than anyone.

notableNPCs.name: Prof. Alton Reed
notableNPCs.description: Believes angels are extraterrestrials. Stripped of faith, obsessed with power.

secrets: Maintains a controlled vampire unit—barely stable.
Knows of a coming supernatural event but lacks the means to stop it.
